meanings.definition: The dialect of English spoken by some African Americans, characterized by nonstandard grammar and pronunciation.
meanings.sent1: Understanding ebonics can bridge communication gaps.
meanings.sent2: The teacher studied ebonics to better connect with students.
meanings.sent3: The ebonics in the rap song added a cool vibe.
meanings.sent4: Her ebonics painted a vivid picture of her roots.
meanings.sent5: Ebonics reflects the rich linguistic diversity in our society.
